description: Assesses depth of character development and character arcs

levels.4: Character is multi-dimensional with contradictions, desires, and fears that feel authentic
levels.3: Character has depth with identifiable traits, motivations, and emotions
levels.2: Character has some traits but feels one-dimensional or stereotypical
levels.1: Character is flat with no clear personality or motivation

feedback_stems.strength: Your character felt genuinely complex, especially when you showed
feedback_stems.growth: Give your character contradictions—real people are complicated

levels.4: Character changes meaningfully through the story; transformation feels earned and believable
levels.3: Character shows clear growth or change by the end
levels.2: Some change hinted at but not fully developed or convincing
levels.1: Character is static; no growth or change

feedback_stems.strength: Your character's transformation was believable and earned, particularly
feedback_stems.growth: Show how events change your character—what do they learn or realize?

levels.4: Rich inner life revealed through thoughts, reactions, and internal conflict
levels.3: Reader has access to character's thoughts and feelings
levels.1: No access to character's inner world

feedback_stems.strength: You gave us deep access to your character's inner world when
feedback_stems.growth: Let readers hear your character's thoughts and feel their internal struggles

levels.4: Specific details (habits, gestures, possessions) reveal character without exposition
levels.2: Details are generic rather than character-specific
levels.1: No revealing details; character is described only in general terms
